result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher A. Hargot was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.  Bond applied, remaining balance refunded

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: NOTICE OF RETAINER AND ENTRY OF APPEARANCE

Prosecutor Kerra Stumbris and Defendant, Christopher A. Hargot appeared, pro se  Defendant was advised of right to attorney and waived that right  at this time.  Defendant finalized  waiver of  right to an attorney after full colloquy to proceed to preliminary hearing on his own.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant is not to drive any motorized vehicle: (a) unless defendant is in possession of a valid Wisconsin operator's license for the type of motor vehicle being driven; (b) defendant and such motor vehicle are insured as required by law; and (c) defendant is in possession of valid proof of insurance while operating the motor vehicle.

ADA Kerra Stumbris appeared for the State  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Clark County Jail  Defendant advised of right to an attorney  Initial appearance scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 10:40 am.
